column4: whazilla:::::::: its probably best if you get dapper, but in the meanwhile use "sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade"
nope. "s'allright" double-L because I am talking in Modern Old English and I am simply joining the words "all" and "right" :P
all contractions involving removal of space require an apostrophe
but the more correct way would be 's'all right
no, the s was simply for sound effects :P
the "'s'" is a contraction of "it's" which is in itself a contraction of "it is"
it is an exclusively Australian usage
Grammar is defined by its use. I am speaking colloquially and thus correctly
I am not saying it is wrong
indeed it is not exclusively Australian, as its in Harry Potter
